Ingredients.5: 0.5 large red bell pepper, finely chopped

Ingredients.6: 1 bunch green onions (green portion only), chopped

Ingredients.10: 2 teaspoons Creole seasoning (such as Tony Chachere's®)

Ingredients.17: 1 pound lump crabmeat, picked free of shell

Ingredients.18: 9  buttery crackers (such as Keebler Club® crackers), crushed

Ingredients.20: 1 For the Spicy Cajun Dipping Sauce-

Ingredients.23: 2 teaspoons Creole seasoning (such as Tony Chachere's®)

Directions.1: Melt butter in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.

Directions.2: Stir in the celery, bell pepper, green onion, carrot, and garlic. Continue to cook and stir until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes more.

Directions.3: Season with 1 tablespoon parsley flakes, 2 teaspoons Creole seasoning, basil, pepper, dill weed, oregano, and thyme. Cook and stir until fragrant, 5 minutes more.

Directions.4: Transfer cooked vegetables to a large bowl; allow to cool for about 10 minutes. Set skillet aside for later use.

Directions.5: Stir the beaten eggs into the vegetables. Mix in the crabmeat and cracker crumbs with your hands, making sure not to break up the chunks of crab too much.

Directions.6: Shape the crab mixture into 12 small cakes.

Directions.7: Heat vegetable oil in the skillet over medium high heat.

Directions.8: Pan-fry the crab cakes in batches until golden brown on each side, about 3 minutes.

Directions.9: To make dipping sauce: Whisk together the mayonnaise, chile-garlic sauce, 2 teaspoon Creole seasoning, 2 teaspoon parsley flakes, and paprika.
